title: 336. The Most Vilified Industry in America Is Also the Most Charitable
description: Pharmaceutical firms donate an enormous amount of their products (and some cash too). But it doesn't seem to be helping their reputation. We ask Pfizer's generosity chief why the company gives so much, who it really helps, and whether all this philanthropy is just corporate whitewashing.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
